memories.content: Paul prefers concise responses without excessive formatting
All API keys and secrets stored in HashiCorp Vault, never in .env files or code
memories.rationale: Security requirement - single source of truth for secrets, audit trail, rotation support

memories.content: Client websites are immutable references - never modify original, only create proxy experiment containers
memories.rationale: Container-on-container architecture principle - originals are sacred, experiments are ephemeral

memories.content: Agent memories must use the 8 canonical types with proper provenance - no untyped memory storage
memories.rationale: Schema-driven architecture prevents drift, enables conflict resolution and promotion paths

memories.content: Origin OS uses container-on-container architecture with LLMs as hypervisors
memories.rationale: Containers provide isolation, reproducibility, and sandboxing for agent experimentation

memories.content: Supreme X Detail serves as proof-of-concept for Origin OS retail optimization capabilities
memories.rationale: Own business provides full control for experimentation, real revenue data, and demonstrable ROI for future partners

memories.content: All container debug logs go to S3 with automatic credential management
memories.rationale: Centralized logging enables debugging across ephemeral containers, cost-effective storage

memories.content: Edge inference targets 5ms latency using Hailo-8 and similar accelerators
memories.rationale: Real-time retail monitoring requires sub-10ms response, Hailo-8 provides best power/performance ratio

memories.content: After MCP config changes: 1) Stop container, 2) Clear cache, 3) Restart container, 4) Verify connection
Session checkpointing: Call checkpoint() after completing significant work, update next_steps list, check for blockers
Crash recovery: 1) Run 'python3 ~/unified-memory/scripts/memory_client.py recover', 2) Read active_task, 3) Resume from next_steps
Launch Supreme X Detail automated booking and follow-up system
Complete unified memory framework with GitHub sync and migration tools
Thunderbolt bandwidth becomes bottleneck before storage speed for container orchestration
CDN-to-origin latency should target sub-20ms; colocate with CDN PoPs and use HTTP/2+ with connection reuse
Container restart required after MCP config changes - hot reload not reliable
Hardware inventory: Multiple Raspberry Pi units, Hailo-8, DX-M1, OAK-D cameras, various microcontrollers
GitHub username: cwalinapj
Supreme X Detail operates in Reno and Sparks, Nevada
Equity-based partnership model (% of profit increase) will be more attractive to retail partners than upfront licensing
Network effects from collective learning across partner stores will compound optimization gains

        elif arr[mid] < target:

        else:

core_architecture: The MacAgent class orchestrates LLM-based reasoning and tool execution for macOS, using components like a key rotator for API key management. The _call_llm method manages LLM communication, implementing rate limit handling through key rotation. Tool execution is managed via a tool registry, supporting both built-in and custom tools.

provider_anthropic_tools: Anthropic (Claude) is best for:
- Complex reasoning and analysis
- Code generation and review
- Long-form text tasks
- Solana/blockchain operations
- Task planning and multi-step execution
Model: claude-sonnet-4-20250514 (fast, capable)
Also supports: claude-opus-4-20250514 (most capable)

all_tools_overview: Mac Agent has 93 tools in these categories:

SOLANA (9 tools):
- solana_config, solana_deploy, solana_program_show, solana_transfer
- counter_init, counter_get, counter_increment, counter_decrement
- call_hello_solana

BUILD (2 tools):
- e2b_build_solana, e2b_build_anchor

VISION (8 tools):
- screenshot, analyze_image, read_screen, ocr_image
- find_ui_element, compare_images, watch_screen, list_screenshots

agent_training_explanation: # Mac Agent Training System Explanation

## Overview
The train_agent.py script is a **synthetic training system** that trains the Mac Agent on all 59 available tools through structured scenarios.

## How It Works

### 1. **Training Categories**
The script organizes tools into 8 categories:
- **file_tools**: glob, grep, list_dir, edit
- **web_tools**: web_fetch, http_request, web_search
- **git_tools**: git_status, git_log, git_branch, git_diff
- **system_tools**: syst...
workflow_file_search: Use glob(pattern='**/*.py') to find Python files, glob(pattern='**/*.ts') for TypeScript
workflow_code_search: Use grep(pattern='def function', path='.') to find function definitions, grep with output_mode='content' to see matching lines
workflow_vision_capture: Use screenshot() for full screen, screenshot(region='100,100,500,500') for area, then analyze_image() or ocr_image() to process

run_agent_entry: The run_agent.py script serves as the main entry point for the Mac Agent, allowing users to interact with the AI agent via command line. It provides multiple functionalities like running in interactive mode, executing specific tasks, creating plans, and listing available tools. It accomplishes this by importing and executing the main function from agent.cli, integrating the project root into the system path for module discovery.

design_pattern_factory: Purpose: Define an interface for creating an object, but let subclasses alter the type of objects that will be created. Key Components: Factory interface or abstract class, concrete creator class, product interface or abstract class, concrete product class. Example: interface Product { void use(); } class ConcreteProduct implements Product { public void use() { System.out.println('Using ConcreteProduct'); } } abstract class Creator { public abstract Product factoryMethod(...

design_pattern_builder: Purpose: Separate the construction of a complex object from its representation, allowing the same construction process to create different representations. Key Components: Builder interface or abstract class, concrete builder classes, director class, product class. Example: class Product { private String partA; private String partB; public void setPartA(String partA) { this.partA = partA; } public void setPartB(String partB) { this.partB = partB; } } interface Builder { v...

design_pattern_adapter: Purpose: Convert the interface of a class into another interface clients expect. Use it when you want to use a class that doesn't have an interface that matches what you need. Key Components: Target interface, adapter class implementing the target interface, adaptee class with an incompatible interface. Example: interface Target { void request(); } class Adaptee { public void specificRequest() { System.out.println('Called specificRequest()'); } } class Adapter implements ...

javascript_array_map: The 'map' method creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.
javascript_array_filter: The 'filter' method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.
javascript_array_reduce: The 'reduce' method executes a reducer function (that you provide) on each element of the array, resulting in single output value.
javascript_array_find: The 'find' method returns the value of the first element in the provided array that satisfies the provided testing function.
javascript_array_findIndex: The 'findIndex' method returns the index of the first element in the array that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise, it returns -1.
javascript_array_some: The 'some' method tests whether at least one element in the array passes the test implemented by the provided function. It returns a Boolean value.
javascript_array_every: The 'every' method tests whether all elements in the array pass the test implemented by the provided function. It returns a Boolean value.
javascript_array_flat: The 'flat' method creates a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the specified depth.
javascript_array_flatMap: The 'flatMap' method first maps each element using a mapping function, then flattens the result into a new array. It is identical to a map followed by a flat of depth 1.
javascript_object_keys: The 'keys' method returns an array of a given object's property names, in the same order as we get with a standard loop.
javascript_object_values: The 'values' method returns an array of a given object's own enumerable property values, in the same order as with a standard loop.
javascript_object_entries: The 'entries' method returns an array of a given object's own enumerable string-keyed property [key, value] pairs, in the same order as we get with a standard loop.
javascript_object_assign: The 'assign' method is used to copy the values of all enumerable own properties from one or more source objects to a target object. It returns the target object.

provenance.source: RunPod SSH requires PTY allocation. Standard SSH commands fail with "Your SSH client does not support PTY". Solution: Use expect scripts to spawn interactive SSH sessions. Example: expect -c "spawn ssh -tt user@ssh.runpod.io; expect #; send command; expect eof"

memories.content: --tags

provenance.source: RunPod API for pod management: Use GraphQL at https://api.runpod.io/graphql with Authorization: Bearer <api_key>. Key mutations: podFindAndDeployOnDemand (create), podResume (start), podTerminate (stop), podReset (restart). Query pod status with runtime field - null means not running.

memories.content: --tags

provenance.source: RunPod volume mount errors: "field Target must not be empty" means volumeInGb parameter is invalid. Fix: Remove volumeInGb and use only containerDiskInGb for container storage instead of persistent volumes.
